definition[0]: a decrease in the amount of money in a bank account, for example because you have taken money out of it
definition[1]: a record in financial accounts that shows money that has been spent or that is owed
definition[2]: to take money out of a bank account
example[0]: The sum of £25 has been debited from your account.
definition[3]: to record in financial accounts the money that has been spent or that is owed
example[1]: Purchases are debited against the client’s account.
definition[4]: a decrease in the amount of money in a bank account, for example when a payment is made from it
definition[5]: the left-hand side of each account in DOUBLE-ENTRY BOOKKEEPING, the side used for decreases in liabilities or REVENUEs
example[2]: Every time an entry is made on the debit side, another entry of equal value must be made on the credit side somewhere in the books.
definition[6]: an amount recorded on the debit side of an account
example[3]: In the plant accounts there is a debit which supports the balance-sheet item.
example[4]: The fee will be automatically debited from your account.
example[5]: The money was debited from my account without even informing me.
definition[7]: to record an amount on the debit side of an account in DOUBLE-ENTRY BOOKKEEPING
example[6]: Note that as the principal repayment reduces the loan outstanding so it is debited to that account.
